Description: Dark green stone spindle-whorl or bead, possibly steatite; biconical with a central vertical piercing; possible signs of wear on the lips, which are also chipped; polished surface.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Whorl or bead is difficult to date on form alone, as the type is found in both the LBA and IA; the tomb itself was used in both periods. See SCE IV/1D, p. 531 & fig. 71; SCE IV/2
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 80, Tomb 98 no. 5)
